{{cpp/experimental/ranges/title|tagged}}
{{cpp/experimental/ranges/utility/tagged/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/ranges/utility|since=ranges|1=
template&lt; class Base, TagSpecifier... Tags &gt;
    requires sizeof...(Tags) &lt;= std::tuple_size&lt;Base&gt;::value
struct tagged;
}}

The class template {{tt|tagged}} augments a tuple-like class type {{tt|Base}}, which it publicly derives from, with a set of named accessors specified by the tag specifiers {{tt|Tags...}}. The tags are applied in order: the i-th tag specifier in {{tt|Tags...}} correspond to the i-th element of the tuple.

The tag specifiers in {{tt|Tags...}} shall be unique. Otherwise, the behavior is undefined.

It is not possible to delete an instance of {{tt|tagged}} through a pointer to any base other than {{tt|Base}}.

==== Named element accessors ====
For the ''N''-th tag specifier in {{tt|Tags...}} whose corresponding element name is ''name'', {{tt|tagged}} provides accessors named ''name'' as follows:

{{source|
constexpr decltype(auto) name() &amp;       { return std::get&lt;N&gt;(*this); }
constexpr decltype(auto) name() const &amp; { return std::get&lt;N&gt;(*this); }
constexpr decltype(auto) name() &amp;&amp;      { return std::get&lt;N&gt;(std::move(*this)); }
}}
